prefix: Approach the following question the way someone in elementary school would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone in elementary school would. What is the greatest number of Sundays that can occur in the first $49$ days of a year?
solution: 49 days is seven full weeks, so there are always $\boxed{7}$ Sundays.
gpt_response:
To figure out the greatest number of Sundays in the first 49 days of a year, we need to see how many weeks are in that time period. Since there are 7 days in a week, we can divide 49 by 7 to get the number of weeks. 

49 ÷ 7 = 7

That means there are 7 weeks in the first 49 days of the year. Since there is always a Sunday at the start of the week, that means there are 7 Sundays in the first 49 days of the year. 

So the greatest number of Sundays that can occur in the first 49 days of a year is 7.
solution_prompt:

49 ÷ 7 = 7

That means there are 7 weeks in the first 49 days of the year. Since there is always a Sunday at the start of the week, that means there are 7 Sundays in the first 49 days of the year. 

So the greatest number of Sundays that can occur in the first 49 days of a year is 7.
